TopicTitle: Docking View - Apollo had it, why can't I?

Articles.Content:
Let me begin by mentioning how awesome it is to be able to dock vehicles. It's expanded KSP by huge leaps and bounds.

That being said, it's always a struggle to determine whether my two vehicles are properly aligned for docking.

Wouldn't it be great if we could switch to the POV of our craft's docking ports? Then I could actually whether or not I'm about to take out a couple solar panels before making my final approach. I can't imagine that the feature would be as difficult to set up as IVA views, and I'd expect to be able to toggle through different ports the same way.

While I'm wishing, I'd love to be able to set another craft's docking port as a target, and have the marker reflect that. (Maybe they fixed that last update, I haven't checked yet.)

Would anyone else find this useful? How hard would this be to code?

Apollo didn't have any docking cameras on their docking ports...they had to look out the window of their capsule or out a little window in the ceiling of the LM.

I use the Lazer Docking Cam mod...it has worked well for me for many versions of KSP.
